{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which of the following is not an etiological agent for gingival recession, we need to review the information provided in the relevant documents. Gingival recession is the apical shift of the marginal gingiva from its normal position on the crown of the tooth. It can be caused by various factors such as trauma, malpositioned teeth, inflammation, tobacco consumption, plaque accumulation, faulty toothbrushing, and more. We need to find the factor that is not mentioned as an etiological agent for gingival recession.", "answer_choice": "B"}
